name: notion_pages
description: Perform various page operations (create, archive, restore, search, update)

action.description: Use this action to create a new page in the database.

parent.description: Optional parent - if not provided, will use NOTION_PAGE_ID as parent page

link.description: Optional link associated with the text

title.description: Array of text segments that make up the title

anyOf.description: Text rich text item request
Equation rich text item request

type.description: Specifies this is a date mention type

start.description: The start date in YYYY-MM-DD format

end.description: The optional end date in YYYY-MM-DD format

anyOf.description: Schema for a date mention block request

type.description: Specifies this is a user mention type

id.description: The unique ID that identifies this specific user

object.description: Identifies this object as a user type

anyOf.description: Schema for a user mention block request

type.description: Specifies this is a page mention type

id.description: The unique ID that identifies this specific page

anyOf.description: Schema for a page mention block request

type.description: Specifies this is a database mention type

id.description: The unique ID that identifies this specific database

anyOf.description: Schema for a database mention block request

type.description: Specifies this is a template mention type
Specifies this is a template mention user type

template_mention.description: Contains the template mention user information

anyOf.description: Schema for a template mention user block request

type.description: Specifies this is a template mention type
Specifies this is a template mention date type

template_mention.description: Contains the template mention date information

anyOf.description: Schema for a template mention date block request
Mention rich text item request

items.description: Union of all possible rich text item request types
Union of all possible text block request types

children.description: Optional array of paragraph blocks to add as page content

anyOf.description: File schema

cover.description: Optional cover image for the page

action.description: Use this action to archive an existing page, making it inactive.

pageId.description: The ID of the page to archive

action.description: Use this action to restore a previously archived page.

pageId.description: The ID of the page to restore

action.description: Use this action to search for pages based on a query.

query.description: Search query for filtering by title

action.description: Use this action to update the properties of an existing page.

pageId.description: The ID of the page to restore

payload.description: A union of all possible page operations. Each operation has a specific action and corresponding parameters. Use this schema to validate the input for page operations such as creating, archiving, restoring, searching, and updating pages. Available actions include: 'create_page', 'archive_page', 'restore_page', 'search_pages', and 'update_page_properties'. Each operation requires specific parameters as defined in the corresponding schemas.

Union of all possible text block request types

children.description: Array of blocks to append as children

action.description: Use this action to retrieve a block.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to retrieve

action.description: Use this action to retrieve children of a block.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to retrieve children for

action.description: Use this action to update a block.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to update

action.description: Use this action to delete/archive a block.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to delete/archive

action.description: Use this action to perform batch append operations on blocks.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to append children to

children.description: Array of blocks to append as children

operations.description: Array of append operations to perform in a single batch

action.description: Use this action to perform batch update operations on blocks.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to update

operations.description: Array of update operations to perform in a single batch

action.description: Use this action to perform batch delete operations on blocks.

items.description: The ID of a block to delete/archive

blockIds.description: Array of block IDs to delete in a single batch

action.description: Use this action to perform batch mixed operations on blocks.

blockId.description: The ID of the block to append children to

children.description: Array of blocks to append as children

blockId.description: The ID of the block to update
The ID of the block to delete/archive

operations.description: Array of mixed operations to perform in a single batch

payload.description: A union of all possible block operations. Each operation has a specific action and corresponding parameters. Use this schema to validate the input for block operations such as appending, retrieving, updating, deleting, and performing batch operations. Available actions include: 'append_block_children', 'retrieve_block', 'retrieve_block_children', 'update_block', 'delete_block', 'batch_append_block_children', 'batch_update_blocks', 'batch_delete_blocks', and 'batch_mixed_operations'. Each operation requires specific parameters as defined in the corresponding schemas.

name: notion_users
description: Perform various user operations (list, get, get bot)

action.description: Use this action to list users.

page_size.description: Number of users to return per page

action.description: Use this action to get a single user.

user_id.description: The ID of the user to retrieve

action.description: Use this action to get the bot user.

payload.description: A union of all possible user operations. Each operation has a specific action and corresponding parameters. Use this schema to validate the input for user operations such as listing, getting a single user, and getting the bot user. Available actions include: 'list_users', 'get_user', and 'get_bot_user'. Each operation requires specific parameters as defined in the corresponding schemas.
